data.legal_notice: For the benefit of all our customers, these guidelines are provided to help you comply with applicable requirements and to help ensure Our's platform remains compliant with global telecommunications ecosystem requirements. These guidelines represent our current understanding of common compliance requirements generally applicable to AngelPBX and its customers, and do not constitute legal advice. By posting these guidelines, AngelPBX makes no assurances regarding the legal compliance of your application built using our APIs. You are expected to understand and abide by all compliance obligations applicable to your specific application. You should check these pages regularly for updates as telecommunications ecosystem requirements continue to evolve and change, and the information below may be updated or changed without notice.

documentation_required.Name: No documentation required*
documentation_required.Address: Address must be within locality or region covered by the phone number's prefix; a PO Box is not acceptable where a local address is required.

individuals.letter_of_authorization: Executed letter of authorization (if required; use template and upload to Console)

documentation_required.Business Address: Business address must be within locality or region covered by phone number’s prefix; a PO Box is not acceptable where a local address is required.

proof_of_local_address: Excerpt from the commercial register showing local address
businesses.letter_of_authorization: Executed letter of authorization (if required; use template and upload to Console)

notes: *Although documentation is not required at this time, AngelPBX advises verifying the accuracy of required information—such as collecting or checking documentary proof.
**If an executed Letter of Authorization (LOA) is required for documentation, please copy the template located on the AngelPBX page, fill it out, and upload it to the Console.

**If an executed Letter of Authorization (LOA) is required for documentation, please copy the template located on the AngelPBX page, fill it out, and upload it to the Console.

sms.mms_support: Converted to SMS with embedded URL

sms_to_landline.behavior: API returns 400, no logs, no charge

compliance_best_practices: Get opt-in consent from each end user before sending communication
Only communicate during daytime hours unless urgent
Support HELP/STOP messages in local language
Do not contact numbers on do-not-call or do-not-disturb registries

data.footer: For the benefit of all our customers, these guidelines are provided to help you comply with applicable requirements and to help ensure Our's platform remains compliant with global telecommunications ecosystem requirements. These guidelines represent our current understanding ... information may be updated or changed without notice.

notes: Business address may be overseas
These numbers must be used for business only

data.legal_notice: National and toll-free numbers are available only to businesses via AngelPBX; individual requests are not supported. Following national telecom rules, documentation includes business registration, ID, and proof‑of‑address. Requirements are based on AngelPBX and Telnyx norms and may change.

toll_free_numbers.note: Numbers are not allowed for calling card or callback service.

data.footer: For the benefit of all our customers, these guidelines are provided to help you comply with applicable requirements and to help ensure Our's platform remains compliant with global telecommunications ecosystem requirements. These guidelines represent our current understanding of common compliance requirements generally applicable to AngelPBX and its customers, and do not constitute legal advice. By posting these guidelines, AngelPBX makes no assurances regarding the legal compliance of your application built using our APIs. You are expected to understand and abide by all compliance obligations applicable to your specific application. You should check these pages regularly for updates as telecommunications ecosystem requirements continue to evolve and change, and the information below may be updated or changed without notice.

sms_guidelines.mms_support: Converted to SMS with embedded URL
compliance_considerations: Get opt‑in consent before sending marketing/non‑essential communications.
Only send messages during user's daytime hours unless urgent.
Support HELP/STOP messages in local language.
Do not contact numbers on do-not-call or do-not-disturb lists.

voice.dialing_change: As of August 3, 2019, Mexican mobile numbers dial using +52 + 10 digits (removed the '1' previously required)
voice.outbound_restriction: Using the old '+52 1 XXXXX...' format risks blocking or higher charges

caller_id.emergency_calls: Not allowed to emergency (911/933) via Our

required_documents: Designation document or Power of Attorney
